A blue ribbon below the anchor contains the text "hope". | Designer = | Type = State }} The '''[[flag]] of the [[State of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations|state of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations]]''' is white and consists of a gold [[Anchored Cross|anchor]] in the center (a symbol for hope) surrounded by thirteen gold stars (for the original [[13 colonies]] and Rhode Island's status as the 13th state to ratify the [[United States Constitution|Constitution]]). A blue ribbon below the anchor bears the state's motto in gold: "[[hope|HOPE]]." The flag is frequently depicted with golden fringe around the edges of the flag. ==History== [[File:Flag of Rhode Island 1882-1897.svg|thumb|left|200px|Flag of Rhode Island 1882-1897]] The flag of the state of Rhode Island as it presently exists was formally adopted in 1897. As early as the 1640s, the anchor and "hope" were found on the [[Rhode Island Seal]], and the seal's words and emblems were likely inspired by the biblical phrase "hope we have as an anchor of the soul," found in [[Hebrews (Bible)|Hebrews]], Verse 6:18-19.<ref>Howard M. Chapin notes published in "Illustrations Of The Seals, Arms And Flags Of Rhode Island," ([[Rhode Island Historical Society]], Providence: 1930) pg 4-5.</ref> Rhode Island's earliest colonists were fleeing religious persecution in Massachusetts due to their Christian beliefs. ==Statute== [[File:RI flag over state house.JPG|thumb|right|200px|Flag of Rhode Island flying over the [[Rhode Island State House|State House]]]] The state of Rhode Island and Providence Plantantions enacted legislation making this the official flag: <blockquote> § 42-4-3 State flag. – The flag of the state shall be white, five feet and six inches (5'6") fly and four feet and ten inches (4'10") deep on the pike, bearing on each side in the center a gold anchor, twenty-two inches (22") high, and underneath it a blue ribbon twenty-four inches (24") long and five inches (5") wide, or in these proportions, with the motto "Hope" in golden letters thereon, the whole surrounded by thirteen (13) golden stars in a circle. The flag shall be edged with yellow fringe. The pike shall be surmounted by a spearhead and the length of the pike shall be nine feet (9'), not including the spearhead.<ref>[http://www.rilin.state.ri.us/Statutes/TITLE42/42-4/42-4-3.HTM Rhode Island State Laws: § 42-4-3 State flag] (accessed January 5, 2009)</ref></blockquote> {{Clear}} == Flag of the Governor == {{See also|Flags of the Governors of the U.S. States}} [[File:Standard of the Governor of Rhode Island.svg|thumb|right|200px|Standard of the Governor of Rhode Island]] The flag of the [[Governor of Rhode Island]] is based on an earlier state flag. Like most U.S. governors' flags, there are four five-point stars at the corners of the field. {{clear}} ==See also== {{Portal|Rhode Island}} *[[State of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations]] **[[Symbols of Rhode Island]] ***[[Seal of the State of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations]] ==References== {{Reflist|1}} ==External links== * [http://www.rilin.state.ri.us/Statutes/TITLE42/42-4/42-4-3.HTM Rhode Island State Laws: § 42-4-3 State flag] * [http://www.fotw.net/flags/us-ri.html Flags of the world Rhode Island page] {{US_state_flags}} {{Rhode Island}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rhode Island, Flag of}} [[Category:United States state flags]] [[Category:Symbols of Rhode Island|Flag]] [[Category:Rhode Island culture|Flag]] [[Category:1897 introductions]]
